violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription: The PERMIT HOLDER shall require FOOD EMPLOYEE applicants and  FOOD EMPLOYEES to report to the PERSON IN CHARGE,  information about their health and activities as they relate to diseases that are transmissible through FOOD. AND report the information in a manner that allows the PERSON IN CHARGE to prevent the likelihood of foodborne disease transmission.(P)
violationsByInspectionidList.problemDescription: Fail to require employees to report illness as rule requires

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription: Except as otherwise allowed, a toilet room located on the PREMISES shall be completely enclosed and provided with a tight-fitting and self-closing door.

A FOOD specified in ¶ 3-501.17(A) or (B) shall be discarded if it:  
    (1) Exceeds the temperature and time combination specified in ¶ 3-501.17(A),              except time that the product is frozen; (P)
    (2) Is in a container or PACKAGE that does not bear a date or day; (P) or
    (3) Is appropriately marked with a date or day that exceeds a temperature and              time combination as specified in ¶ 3-501.17(A). (P)
violationsByInspectionidList.itemDescription: Ready to eat, potentially hazardous food(s)

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription: A test kit or other device that accurately measures the concentration in mg/L of SANITIZING solutions shall be provided. (Pf)
UTENSILS and FOOD-CONTACT SURFACES of EQUIPMENT shall be SANITIZED before use after cleaning. (P)
violationsByInspectionidList.correctionDescription: Equipment/utensils must be sanitized after cleaning.

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription: A sign or poster that notifies FOOD EMPLOYEES to wash their hands shall be provided at all HANDWASHING SINKS used by FOOD EMPLOYEES and shall be clearly visible to FOOD EMPLOYEES.
EQUIPMENT shall be maintained in a state of repair and condition that meets the requirements of the code.
Cleaned EQUIPMENT and UTENSILS, laundered LINENS, and SINGLE-SERVICE and SINGLE-USE ARTICLES shall be stored in an approved manner and location.
violationsByInspectionidList.problemDescription: Exposed to dust, splash, or other contaminates

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription: EQUIPMENT that is fixed because it is not EASILY MOVABLE shall be installed so that it is spaced to allow access for cleaning along the sides, behind, and above the EQUIPMENT or sealed as required,  COUNTER-MOUNTED EQUIPMENT that is not EASILY MOVABLE shall be installed to allow cleaning of the EQUIPMENT and areas underneath and around the EQUIPMENT .
violationsByInspectionidList.correctionDescription: Seal to wall/equipment to facilitate cleaning.

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription:
Materials for indoor floor, wall, and ceiling surfaces under conditions of normal use shall be:
(1) SMOOTH, durable, and EASILY CLEANABLE for areas where FOOD ESTABLISHMENT operations are conducted;
(2) Closely woven and EASILY CLEANABLE carpet for carpeted areas; and
(3) Nonabsorbent for areas subject to moisture such as FOOD preparation areas, walk-in refrigerators, WAREWASHING areas, toilet rooms, mobile FOOD ESTABLISHMENT SERVICING AREAS, and areas subject to flushing or spray cleaning methods.
Except as otherwise allowed, a toilet room located on the PREMISES shall be completely enclosed and provided with a tight-fitting and self-closing door.
